3 mm macrame cord stitch marker s scissors tape measure tapestry needle gauge 7 sts and 7 row in single_crochet = 2 gauge is not essential to this design finished measurements height = 9 width = 10 5 stitches/abbreviations used chain chain single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st stitch sts stitches 2 pattern notes ● pattern directions are written using us crochet terminology ● this bag is worked with two strands of yarn held together throughout ● the base and body of the bag are worked in continuous rounds without joining ● to achieve a similar finished result use one variegated colorway held with a solid colorway ● finished size and look will vary based on yarn choice hook size and personal crochet gauge directions - bag base/body use two strands of yarn throughout note the bag base increases by a total of 6 sts for each round if you prefer a more rounded base as opposed to a hexagon shape consider staggering the increases in each round so that they are not stacked on top of the increase sts of the previous round be careful to make sure that the stitch count for each round is accurate round 1 with hook chain 2 work 6 single_crochet sts in 2nd chain from hook if you prefer make a magic_ring and work 6 single_crochet in the center 6 note i found it helpful to use a st marker to identify the first st of the round and moved it up as i completed each consecutive round round 2 without joining work 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 round 3 work 2sc in first st 1 single_crochet in next st * 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next st repeat from * around 18 round 4 work 2 single_crochet in first st 1 single_crochet in each of the next 2 sts * 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in each of next 2 sts repeat from * around 24 round 5 work 2 single_crochet in first st 1 single_crochet in each of next 3 sts * 2sc in next st 1 single_crochet in each
